isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CATERPILLAR - 1992-1993 - DIAGNOSTICS - DETERMINING FAULT CODES

svcprocinfo.para: MPSI Prolink 9000 or Caterpillar Electronic Service Tools can be used to identify logged fault codes. Refer to the service tool manual instructions on reading codes.
To use the yellow "Engine Warning" light to read the flash codes, use the following procedures.

svcsubproc.title: Reading Flash Codes
svcsubproc.para: When the key is turned to the ignition position, the yellow Engine Warning light comes ON for approximately 6 seconds, then goes off for several more seconds, then begins to "flash" any logged fault codes. If there are no logged fault codes, it will flash a code "55."

step1.para: Start engine and allow to run at low idle for about 30 seconds.
Turn cruise ON/OFF switch to OFF position.
Hold cruise SET/RESUME switch in the RESUME position until codes begin to "flash," then release.

note.para: All Caterpillar flash codes are two-digit numbers.

step1.para: The yellow Engine Warning light will flash the first digit.
At the end of the first digit, there will be a one or two second pause.
The yellow Engine Warning light will flash the second digit.
There will be a two to three second pause between flash codes.
The second and all successive fault codes will "flash" until all codes are shown.
To stop the diagnostics procedure, do nothing. To see the fault codes again, repeat steps 4 through 10.
Caterpillar fault codes are listed in the Caterpillar manual which comes with the vehicle and in the Prolink manual for the Caterpillar cartridge.
